title: How to Put Links on Instagram

steps.title: Open the Instagram app.
steps.content: Open the Instagram app.

steps.title: Tap the icon.
steps.content: Tap the icon. It looks like a person and is at the bottom-right of the app.

steps.title: Tap “Edit Profile.”
steps.content: Tap “ Edit Profile .”

steps.title: Tap “Website.”
steps.content: Tap “Website.”

steps.title: Type in a website.
steps.content: Type in a website. If you want to link to multiple sites, you can use a third-party service (like Linktree) to bundle several links into just one. [1] X Expert Source Christina Bachelor Marketing & Advertising Specialist Expert Interview. 23 April 2021.

steps.title: Tap “Done.”
steps.content: Tap “Done.” Done is in the upper-right corner. You’ll be taken back to the profile screen. You should see the website you entered under your name.

steps.title: Tap the Instagram icon.
steps.content: Tap the Instagram icon.

steps.title: Tap the icon.
steps.content: Tap the icon. It looks like a person and is at the bottom-right of the app.

steps.title: Tap a photo.
steps.content: Tap a photo. Your photos are below your profile name.

steps.title: Tap the chat icon.
steps.content: Tap the chat icon. It is below your photo, to the right of the heart icon. You should see a blinking cursor in a box that says “Add a comment.”

steps.title: Type a username.
steps.content: Type a username. You can choose any name from the drop-down, but think of tagging as starting a conversation. Pick someone who will find the post or comment relevant. [2] X Expert Source Christina Bachelor Marketing & Advertising Specialist Expert Interview. 23 April 2021. Instagram usernames begin with the @symbol, e.g. @johndoe.

steps.title: Tap “Post.”
steps.content: Tap “Post.” The Post button is to the right of your comment. You should see the username in the comment box. Now users can click on the username to visit the profile of the user, who has been “tagged” in the comment.

steps.title: Tap the Instagram icon.
steps.content: Tap the Instagram icon.

steps.title: Tap the icon.
steps.content: Tap the icon. It looks like a person and is at the bottom-right of the app.

steps.title: Tap a photo.
steps.content: Tap a photo. Your photos are below your profile name.

steps.title: Tap the three dots.
steps.content: Tap the three dots. They are in the upper-right of the photo. A white window will appear.

steps.title: Tap “Edit.”
steps.content: Tap “Edit.” The Edit button is in the white pop-up window. You’ll see a white overlay on the photo that says “Tag People.”

steps.title: Tap “Tag People.”
steps.content: Tap “Tag People.” The command is in white text over the photo. You’ll be instructed to tap the photo. The tag will be placed in the spot you tap.

steps.title: Tap the photo.
steps.content: Tap the photo. You’ll see an empty box with a blinking cursor.

steps.title: Type a username in the box.
steps.content: Type a username in the box. As you type, auto-fill will provide a drop-down where you can choose someone to tag.

steps.title: Tap a username.
steps.content: Tap a username. After you pick a username to tag, you’ll be directed back to the photo.

steps.title: Tap “Done.”
steps.content: Tap “Done.” The command is at the upper-right. After you tap “Done,” you’ll see the username you chose in the photo. Users can click directly on the username to visit the profile of the user, who has now been “tagged” in the photo.
